page.title: 16FARMING..CHANGES
page.content: In the 1940's most farm workers lived in tied cottages or ploughman's bothies. Now, however, most prefer to live in Cupar and travel to work by car. Some of the cottages have been renevated and let or sold to non-farming people, although many have fallen into despair. In the 1940's teams of men were brought in at harvest time for about 3 weeks work, which finished with the Harvest Home Celebrations. Nowadays farming is highly mechanised. Many big farms employed family teams to work as gardener/cook/maid etc. One lady we interviewed worked as a maid at Craigsanqhar, with only two hours off a week, on a Saturday. She also remembers in 1947 the Foodie/Denbrae being blocked by snow and cleared by German prisoners of war.
